00057 PyC_FlagSet bpy_bm_scene_vert_edge_face_flags[] = {
00058     {1, "VERT"},
00059     {2, "EDGE"},
00060     {4, "FACE"},
00061     {0, NULL}
00062 };
00063 
00064 PyC_FlagSet bpy_bm_htype_vert_edge_face_flags[] = {
00065     {BM_VERT, "VERT"},
00066     {BM_EDGE, "EDGE"},
00067     {BM_FACE, "FACE"},
00068     {0, NULL}
00069 };

00073     {BM_LOOP, "EDGE"},

00075     {BM_LOOP, "LOOP"},

00098 PyDoc_STRVAR(bpy_bm_elem_select_doc,  "Selected state of this element.\n\n:type: boolean");
00099 PyDoc_STRVAR(bpy_bm_elem_hide_doc,    "Hidden state of this element.\n\n:type: boolean");
00100 PyDoc_STRVAR(bpy_bm_elem_tag_doc,     "Generic attribute scripts can use for own logic\n\n:type: boolean");
00101 PyDoc_STRVAR(bpy_bm_elem_smooth_doc,  "Smooth state of this element.\n\n:type: boolean");
00102 PyDoc_STRVAR(bpy_bm_elem_seam_doc,    "Seam for UV unwrapping.\n\n:type: boolean");

00104 
00105 static PyObject *bpy_bm_elem_hflag_get(BPy_BMElem *self, void *flag)
00106 {
00107     const char hflag = (char)GET_INT_FROM_POINTER(flag);
00108 
00109     BPY_BM_CHECK_OBJ(self);
00110 
00111     return PyBool_FromLong(BM_elem_flag_test(self->ele, hflag));
00112 }
00113 
00114 static int bpy_bm_elem_hflag_set(BPy_BMElem *self, PyObject *value, void *flag)
00115 {
00116     const char hflag = (char)GET_INT_FROM_POINTER(flag);
00117     int param;
00118 
00119     BPY_BM_CHECK_INT(self);
00120 
00121     param = PyLong_AsLong(value);
00122 
00123     if (param == TRUE) {
00124         BM_elem_flag_enable(self->ele, hflag);
00125         return 0;
00126     }
00127     else if (param == FALSE) {
00128         BM_elem_flag_disable(self->ele, hflag);
00129         return 0;
00130     }
00131     else {
00132         PyErr_Format(PyExc_TypeError,
00133                      "expected True/False or 0/1, not %.200s",
00134                      Py_TYPE(value)->tp_name);
00135         return -1;
00136     }
00137 }
00138 
00139 
00140 PyDoc_STRVAR(bpy_bm_elem_index_doc,
00141 "Index of this element.\n"
00142 "\n"
00143 ":type: int\n"
00144 "\n"
00145 ".. note::\n"
00146 "\n"
00147 "   This value is not necessarily valid, while editing the mesh it can become *dirty*.\n"
00148 "\n"
00149 "   It's also possible to assign any number to this attribute for a scripts internal logic.\n"
00150 "\n"
00151 "   To ensure the value is up to date - see :class:`BMElemSeq.index_update`.\n"
00152 );
00153 static PyObject *bpy_bm_elem_index_get(BPy_BMElem *self, void *UNUSED(flag))
00154 {
00155     BPY_BM_CHECK_OBJ(self);
00156 
00157     return PyLong_FromLong(BM_elem_index_get(self->ele));
00158 }
00159 
00160 static int bpy_bm_elem_index_set(BPy_BMElem *self, PyObject *value, void *UNUSED(flag))
00161 {
00162     int param;
00163 
00164     BPY_BM_CHECK_INT(self);
00165 
00166     param = PyLong_AsLong(value);
00167 
00168     if (param == -1 && PyErr_Occurred()) {
00169         PyErr_SetString(PyExc_TypeError,
00170                         "expected an int type");
00171         return -1;
00172     }
00173     else {
00174         BM_elem_index_set(self->ele, param); /* set_dirty! */
00175 
00176         /* when setting the index assume its set invalid */
00177         if (self->ele->head.htype & (BM_VERT | BM_EDGE | BM_FACE)) {
00178             self->bm->elem_index_dirty |= self->ele->head.htype;
00179         }
00180 
00181         return 0;
00182     }
00183 }

00280 PyDoc_STRVAR(bpy_bmesh_is_wrapped_doc,
00281 "True when this mesh is owned by blender (typically the editmode BMesh).\n\n:type: boolean"
00282 );
00283 static PyObject *bpy_bmesh_is_wrapped_get(BPy_BMesh *self)
00284 {
00285     BPY_BM_CHECK_OBJ(self);
00286 
00287     return PyBool_FromLong(self->flag & BPY_BMFLAG_IS_WRAPPED);
00288 }
00289 
00290 PyDoc_STRVAR(bpy_bmesh_select_mode_doc,
00291 "The selection mode, values can be {'VERT', 'EDGE', 'FACE'}, can't be assigned an empty set.\n\n:type: set"
00292 );
00293 static PyObject *bpy_bmesh_select_mode_get(BPy_BMesh *self)
00294 {
00295     BPY_BM_CHECK_OBJ(self);
00296 
00297     return PyC_FlagSet_FromBitfield(bpy_bm_scene_vert_edge_face_flags, self->bm->selectmode);
00298 }
00299 
00300 static int bpy_bmesh_select_mode_set(BPy_BMesh *self, PyObject *value)
00301 {
00302     int flag = 0;
00303     BPY_BM_CHECK_INT(self);
00304 
00305     if (PyC_FlagSet_ToBitfield(bpy_bm_scene_vert_edge_face_flags, value, &flag, "bm.select_mode") == -1) {
00306         return -1;
00307     }
00308     else if (flag == 0) {
00309         PyErr_SetString(PyExc_TypeError,
00310                         "bm.select_mode: cant assignt an empty value");
00311         return -1;
00312     }
00313     else {
00314         self->bm->selectmode = flag;
00315         return 0;
00316     }
00317 }
00318 
00319 PyDoc_STRVAR(bpy_bmesh_select_history_doc,
00320 "Sequence of selected items (the last is displayed as active).\n\n:type: :class:`BMEditSelSeq`"
00321 );
00322 static PyObject *bpy_bmesh_select_history_get(BPy_BMesh *self)
00323 {
00324     BPY_BM_CHECK_OBJ(self);
00325 
00326     return BPy_BMEditSel_CreatePyObject(self->bm);
00327 }
00328 
00329 static int bpy_bmesh_select_history_set(BPy_BMesh *self, PyObject *value)
00330 {
00331     BPY_BM_CHECK_INT(self);
00332 
00333     return BPy_BMEditSel_Assign(self, value);
00334 }

00340 "The coordinates for this vertex as a 3D, wrapped vector.\n\n:type: :class:`mathutils.Vector`"
00341 );
00342 static PyObject *bpy_bmvert_co_get(BPy_BMVert *self)

00344     BPY_BM_CHECK_OBJ(self);
00345     return Vector_CreatePyObject(self->v->co, 3, Py_WRAP, NULL);
00346 }
00347 
00348 static int bpy_bmvert_co_set(BPy_BMVert *self, PyObject *value)
00349 {
00350     BPY_BM_CHECK_INT(self);
00351 
00352     if (mathutils_array_parse(self->v->co, 3, 3, value, "BMVert.co") != -1) {
00353         return 0;
00354     }
00355     else {
00356         return -1;
00357     }
00358 }

00460 PyDoc_STRVAR(bpy_bmface_material_index_doc,
00461 "The faces material index.\n\n:type: int"
00462 );
00463 static PyObject *bpy_bmface_material_index_get(BPy_BMFace *self)
00464 {
00465     BPY_BM_CHECK_OBJ(self);
00466     return PyLong_FromLong(self->f->mat_nr);
00467 }
00468 
00469 static int bpy_bmface_material_index_set(BPy_BMFace *self, PyObject *value)
00470 {
00471     int param;
00472 
00473     BPY_BM_CHECK_INT(self);
00474 
00475     param = PyLong_AsLong(value);
00476 
00477     if (param == -1 && PyErr_Occurred()) {
00478         PyErr_SetString(PyExc_TypeError,
00479                         "expected an int type");
00480         return -1;
00481     }
00482     else if ((param < 0) || (param > MAXMAT)) {
00483         /* normally we clamp but in this case raise an error */
00484         PyErr_SetString(PyExc_ValueError,
00485                         "material index outside of usable range (0 - 32766)");
00486         return -1;
00487     }
00488     else {
00489         self->f->mat_nr = (short)param;
00490         return 0;
00491     }
00492 }

00693 
00694 PyDoc_STRVAR(bpy_bmesh_copy_doc,
00695 ".. method:: copy()\n"
00696 "\n"
00697 "   :return: A copy of this BMesh.\n"
00698 "   :rtype: :class:`BMesh`\n"
00699 );
00700 static PyObject *bpy_bmesh_copy(BPy_BMesh *self)
00701 {
00702     BMesh *bm;
00703     BMesh *bm_copy;
00704 
00705     BPY_BM_CHECK_OBJ(self);
00706 
00707     bm = self->bm;
00708 
00709     bm_copy = BM_mesh_copy(bm);
00710 
00711     if (bm_copy) {
00712         return BPy_BMesh_CreatePyObject(bm_copy, BPY_BMFLAG_NOP);
00713     }
00714     else {
00715         PyErr_SetString(PyExc_SystemError, "Unable to copy BMesh, internal error");
00716         return NULL;
00717     }
00718 }
00719 
00720 PyDoc_STRVAR(bpy_bmesh_clear_doc,
00721 ".. method:: clear()\n"
00722 "\n"
00723 "   Clear all mesh data.\n"
00724 );
00725 static PyObject *bpy_bmesh_clear(BPy_BMesh *self)
00726 {
00727     BMesh *bm;
00728 
00729     BPY_BM_CHECK_OBJ(self);
00730 
00731     bm = self->bm;
00732 
00733     BM_mesh_clear(bm);
00734 
00735     Py_RETURN_NONE;
00736 }
00737 
00738 PyDoc_STRVAR(bpy_bmesh_free_doc,
00739 ".. method:: free()\n"
00740 "\n"
00741 "   Explicitly free the BMesh data from memory, causing exceptions on further access.\n"
00742 "\n"
00743 "   .. note::\n"
00744 "\n"
00745 "      The BMesh is freed automatically, typically when the script finishes executing.\n"
00746 "      However in some cases its hard to predict when this will be and its useful to\n"
00747 "      explicitly free the data.\n"
00748 );
00749 static PyObject *bpy_bmesh_free(BPy_BMesh *self)
00750 {
00751     if (self->bm) {
00752         BMesh *bm = self->bm;
00753 
00754         if ((self->flag & BPY_BMFLAG_IS_WRAPPED) == 0) {
00755             BM_mesh_free(bm);
00756         }
00757 
00758         bpy_bm_generic_invalidate((BPy_BMGeneric *)self);
00759     }
00760 
00761     Py_RETURN_NONE;
00762 }
00763 
00764 PyDoc_STRVAR(bpy_bmesh_to_mesh_doc,
00765 ".. method:: to_mesh(mesh)\n"
00766 "\n"
00767 "   Writes this BMesh data into an existing Mesh datablock.\n"
00768 "\n"
00769 "   :arg mesh: The mesh data to write into.\n"
00770 "   :type mesh: :class:`Mesh`\n"
00771 );
00772 static PyObject *bpy_bmesh_to_mesh(BPy_BMesh *self, PyObject *args)
00773 {
00774     PyObject *py_mesh;
00775     Mesh *me;
00776     BMesh *bm;
00777 
00778     BPY_BM_CHECK_OBJ(self);
00779 
00780     if (!PyArg_ParseTuple(args, "O:to_mesh", &py_mesh) ||
00781         !(me = PyC_RNA_AsPointer(py_mesh, "Mesh")))
00782     {
00783         return NULL;
00784     }
00785 
00786     /* we could allow this but its almost certainly _not_ what script authors want */
00787     if (me->edit_btmesh) {
00788         PyErr_Format(PyExc_ValueError,
00789                      "to_mesh(): Mesh '%s' is in editmode", me->id.name + 2);
00790         return NULL;
00791     }
00792 
00793     bm = self->bm;
00794 
00795     BM_mesh_bm_to_me(bm, me, FALSE);
00796 
00797     /* we could have the user do this but if they forget blender can easy crash
00798      * since the references arrays for the objects derived meshes are now invalid */
00799     DAG_id_tag_update(&me->id, OB_RECALC_DATA);
00800 
00801     Py_RETURN_NONE;
00802 }
00803 
00804 /* note: rna_Object_to_mesh() also has apply_modifiers arg that works the same way */
00805 PyDoc_STRVAR(bpy_bmesh_from_object_doc,
00806 ".. method:: from_object(mesh, apply_modifiers=True)\n"
00807 "\n"
00808 "   Initialize this bmesh from existing object datablock.\n"
00809 "\n"
00810 "   :arg object: The object data to load.\n"
00811 "   :type object: :class:`Object`\n"
00812 "   :arg apply_modifiers: Use the final display mesh rather then the deformed cage.\n"
00813 "   :type apply_modifiers: boolean\n"
00814 );
00815 static PyObject *bpy_bmesh_from_object(BPy_BMesh *self, PyObject *args)
00816 {
00817     PyObject *py_object;
00818     Object *ob;
00819     BMesh *bm;
00820     int apply_modifiers = TRUE;
00821     DerivedMesh *dm;
00822 
00823     BPY_BM_CHECK_OBJ(self);
00824 
00825     if (!PyArg_ParseTuple(args, "O|i:from_object", &py_object, &apply_modifiers) ||
00826         !(ob = PyC_RNA_AsPointer(py_object, "Object")))
00827     {
00828         return NULL;
00829     }
00830 
00831     dm = apply_modifiers ? ob->derivedFinal : ob->derivedDeform;
00832 
00833     if (dm == NULL) {
00834         PyErr_Format(PyExc_ValueError,
00835                      "from_object(...): Object '%s' has no usable mesh data", ob->id.name + 2);
00836         return NULL;
00837     }
00838 
00839     bm = self->bm;
00840 
00841     DM_to_bmesh_ex(dm, bm);
00842 
00843     Py_RETURN_NONE;
00844 }
00845 
00846 
00847 PyDoc_STRVAR(bpy_bmesh_from_mesh_doc,
00848 ".. method:: from_mesh(mesh, use_shape_key=False, shape_key_index=0)\n"
00849 "\n"
00850 "   Initialize this bmesh from existing mesh datablock.\n"
00851 "\n"
00852 "   :arg mesh: The mesh data to load.\n"
00853 "   :type mesh: :class:`Mesh`\n"
00854 "   :arg use_shape_key: Use the locations from a shape key.\n"
00855 "   :type use_shape_key: boolean\n"
00856 "   :arg shape_key_index: The shape key index to use.\n"
00857 "   :type shape_key_index: int\n"
00858 );
00859 static PyObject *bpy_bmesh_from_mesh(BPy_BMesh *self, PyObject *args, PyObject *kw)
00860 {
00861     static const char *kwlist[] = {"mesh", "use_shape_key", "shape_key_index", NULL};
00862     BMesh *bm;
00863     PyObject *py_mesh;
00864     Mesh *me;
00865     int use_shape_key = FALSE;
00866     int shape_key_index = 0;
00867 
00868     if (!PyArg_ParseTupleAndKeywords(args, kw, "O|ii:from_mesh", (char **)kwlist,
00869                                      &py_mesh, &use_shape_key, &shape_key_index) ||
00870         !(me = PyC_RNA_AsPointer(py_mesh, "Mesh")))
00871     {
00872         return NULL;
00873     }
00874 
00875     bm = self->bm;
00876 
00877     BM_mesh_bm_from_me(bm, me, use_shape_key, shape_key_index + 1);
00878 
00879     Py_RETURN_NONE;
00880 }

00898 PyDoc_STRVAR(bpy_bmesh_select_flush_doc,
00899 ".. method:: select_flush(select)\n"
00900 "\n"
00901 "   Flush selection, independent of the current selection mode.\n"
00902 "\n"
00903 "   :arg select: flush selection or de-selected elements.\n"
00904 "   :type select: boolean\n"
00905 );
00906 static PyObject *bpy_bmesh_select_flush(BPy_BMesh *self, PyObject *value)
00907 {
00908     int param;
00909 
00910     BPY_BM_CHECK_OBJ(self);
00911 
00912     param = PyLong_AsLong(value);
00913     if (param != FALSE && param != TRUE) {
00914         PyErr_SetString(PyExc_TypeError,
00915                         "expected a boolean type 0/1");
00916         return NULL;
00917     }
00918 
00919     if (param)  BM_mesh_select_flush(self->bm);
00920     else        BM_mesh_deselect_flush(self->bm);
00921 
00922     Py_RETURN_NONE;
00923 }

00950 
00951 PyDoc_STRVAR(bpy_bmesh_transform_doc,
00952 ".. method:: transform(matrix, filter=None)\n"
00953 "\n"
00954 "   Transform the mesh (optionally filtering flagged data only).\n"
00955 "\n"
00956 "   :arg matrix: transform matrix.\n"
00957 "   :type matrix: 4x4 :class:`mathutils.Matrix`\n"
00958 "   :arg filter: set of values in ('SELECT', 'HIDE', 'SEAM', 'SMOOTH', 'TAG').\n"
00959 "   :type filter: set\n"
00960 );
00961 static PyObject *bpy_bmesh_transform(BPy_BMElem *self, PyObject *args, PyObject *kw)
00962 {
00963     static const char *kwlist[] = {"matrix", "filter", NULL};
00964 
00965     MatrixObject *mat;
00966     PyObject *filter = NULL;
00967     int filter_flags = 0;
00968 
00969     BPY_BM_CHECK_OBJ(self);
00970 
00971     if (!PyArg_ParseTupleAndKeywords(args, kw,
00972                                      "O!|O!:transform",
00973                                      (char **)kwlist,
00974                                      &matrix_Type, &mat,
00975                                      &PySet_Type,  &filter))
00976     {
00977         return NULL;
00978     }
00979     else {
00980         BMVert *eve;
00981         BMIter iter;
00982         void *mat_ptr;
00983 
00984         if (BaseMath_ReadCallback(mat) == -1) {
00985             return NULL;
00986         }
00987         else if (mat->num_col != 4 || mat->num_row != 4) {
00988             PyErr_SetString(PyExc_ValueError,
00989                             "expected a 4x4 matrix");
00990             return NULL;
00991         }
00992 
00993         if (filter != NULL && PyC_FlagSet_ToBitfield(bpy_bm_hflag_all_flags, filter,
00994                                                      &filter_flags, "bm.transform") == -1)
00995         {
00996             return NULL;
00997         }
00998 
00999         mat_ptr = mat->matrix;
01000 
01001         if (!filter_flags) {
01002             BM_ITER_MESH (eve, &iter, self->bm, BM_VERTS_OF_MESH) {
01003                 mul_m4_v3((float (*)[4])mat_ptr, eve->co);
01004             }
01005         }
01006         else {
01007             char filter_flags_ch = (char)filter_flags;
01008             BM_ITER_MESH (eve, &iter, self->bm, BM_VERTS_OF_MESH) {
01009                 if (eve->head.hflag & filter_flags_ch) {
01010                     mul_m4_v3((float (*)[4])mat_ptr, eve->co);
01011                 }
01012             }
01013         }
01014     }
01015 
01016     Py_RETURN_NONE;
01017 }
01018 
01019 
01020 /* Elem
01021  * ---- */
01022 
01023 PyDoc_STRVAR(bpy_bm_elem_select_set_doc,
01024 ".. method:: select_set(select)\n"
01025 "\n"
01026 "   Set the selection.\n"
01027 "   This is different from the *select* attribute because it updates the selection state of assosiated geometry.\n"
01028 "\n"
01029 "   :arg select: Select or de-select.\n"
01030 "   :type select: boolean\n"
01031 "\n"
01032 "   .. note::\n"
01033 "\n"
01034 "      Currently this only flushes down, so selecting a face will select all its vertices but de-selecting a vertex "
01035 "      won't de-select all the faces that use it, before finishing with a mesh typically flushing is still needed.\n"
01036 );
01037 static PyObject *bpy_bm_elem_select_set(BPy_BMElem *self, PyObject *value)
01038 {
01039     int param;
01040 
01041     BPY_BM_CHECK_OBJ(self);
01042 
01043     param = PyLong_AsLong(value);
01044     if (param != FALSE && param != TRUE) {
01045         PyErr_SetString(PyExc_TypeError,
01046                         "expected a boolean type 0/1");
01047         return NULL;
01048     }
01049 
01050     BM_elem_select_set(self->bm, self->ele, param);
01051 
01052     Py_RETURN_NONE;
01053 }
01054 
01055 
01056 PyDoc_STRVAR(bpy_bm_elem_hide_set_doc,
01057 ".. method:: hide_set(hide)\n"
01058 "\n"
01059 "   Set the hide state.\n"
01060 "   This is different from the *hide* attribute because it updates the selection and hide state of assosiated geometry.\n"
01061 "\n"
01062 "   :arg hide: Hidden or visible.\n"
01063 "   :type hide: boolean\n"
01064 );
01065 static PyObject *bpy_bm_elem_hide_set(BPy_BMElem *self, PyObject *value)
01066 {
01067     int param;
01068 
01069     BPY_BM_CHECK_OBJ(self);
01070 
01071     param = PyLong_AsLong(value);
01072     if (param != FALSE && param != TRUE) {
01073         PyErr_SetString(PyExc_TypeError,
01074                         "expected a boolean type 0/1");
01075         return NULL;
01076     }
01077 
01078     BM_elem_hide_set(self->bm, self->ele, param);
01079 
01080     Py_RETURN_NONE;
01081 }
01082 
01083 
01084 PyDoc_STRVAR(bpy_bm_elem_copy_from_doc,
01085 ".. method:: copy_from(other)\n"
01086 "\n"
01087 "   Copy values from another element of matching type.\n"
01088 );
01089 static PyObject *bpy_bm_elem_copy_from(BPy_BMElem *self, BPy_BMElem *value)
01090 {
01091     BPY_BM_CHECK_OBJ(self);
01092 
01093     if (Py_TYPE(self) != Py_TYPE(value)) {
01094         PyErr_Format(PyExc_TypeError,
01095                      "expected element of type '%.200s' not '%.200s'",
01096                      Py_TYPE(self)->tp_name, Py_TYPE(value)->tp_name);
01097         return NULL;
01098     }
01099 
01100     if (value->ele != self->ele) {
01101         BM_elem_attrs_copy(value->bm, self->bm, value->ele, self->ele);
01102     }
01103 
01104     Py_RETURN_NONE;
01105 }
01106 
01107 
01108 /* Vert
01109  * ---- */
01110 
01111 
01112 PyDoc_STRVAR(bpy_bmvert_copy_from_vert_interp_doc,
01113 ".. method:: copy_from_vert_interp(vert_pair, fac)\n"
01114 "\n"
01115 "   Interpolate the customdata from a vert between 2 other verts.\n"
01116 "\n"
01117 "   :arg vert_pair: The vert to interpolate data from.\n"
01118 "   :type vert_pair: :class:`BMVert`\n"
01119 );
01120 static PyObject *bpy_bmvert_copy_from_vert_interp(BPy_BMVert *self, PyObject *args)
01121 {
01122     PyObject *vert_seq;
01123     float fac;
01124 
01125     BPY_BM_CHECK_OBJ(self);
01126 
01127     if (!PyArg_ParseTuple(args, "Of:BMVert.copy_from_vert_interp",
01128                           &vert_seq, &fac))
01129     {
01130         return NULL;
01131     }
01132     else {
01133         BMesh *bm = self->bm;
01134         BMVert **vert_array = NULL;
01135         Py_ssize_t vert_seq_len; /* always 2 */
01136 
01137         vert_array = BPy_BMElem_PySeq_As_Array(&bm, vert_seq, 2, 2,
01138                                                &vert_seq_len, BM_VERT,
01139                                                TRUE, TRUE, "BMVert.copy_from_vert_interp(...)");
01140 
01141         if (vert_array == NULL) {
01142             return NULL;
01143         }
01144 
01145         BM_data_interp_from_verts(bm, vert_array[0], vert_array[1], self->v, CLAMPIS(fac, 0.0f, 1.0f));
01146 
01147         PyMem_FREE(vert_array);
01148         Py_RETURN_NONE;
01149     }
01150 }
01151

01262 PyDoc_STRVAR(bpy_bmedge_calc_tangent_doc,
01263 ".. method:: calc_tangent(loop)\n"
01264 "\n"
01265 "   Return the tangent at this edge relative to a face (pointing inward into the face).\n"
01266 "   This uses the face normal for calculation.\n"
01267 "\n"
01268 "   :arg loop: The loop used for tangent calculation.\n"
01269 "   :type loop: :class:`BMLoop`\n"
01270 "   :return: a normalized vector.\n"
01271 "   :rtype: :class:`mathutils.Vector`\n"
01272 );
01273 static PyObject *bpy_bmedge_calc_tangent(BPy_BMEdge *self, PyObject *args)
01274 {
01275     BPy_BMLoop *py_loop;
01276     BPY_BM_CHECK_OBJ(self);
01277 
01278     if (!PyArg_ParseTuple(args, "O!:BMEdge.calc_face_tangent",
01279                           &BPy_BMLoop_Type, &py_loop))
01280     {
01281         return NULL;
01282     }
01283     else {
01284         float vec[3];
01285         BPY_BM_CHECK_OBJ(py_loop);
01286         /* no need to check if they are from the same mesh or even connected */
01287         BM_edge_calc_face_tangent(self->e, py_loop->l, vec);
01288         return Vector_CreatePyObject(vec, 3, Py_NEW, NULL);
01289     }
01290 }

01292 
01293 PyDoc_STRVAR(bpy_bmedge_other_vert_doc,
01294 ".. method:: other_vert(vert)\n"
01295 "\n"
01296 "   Return the other vertex on this edge or None if the vertex is not used by this edge.\n"
01297 "\n"
01298 "   :arg vert: a vert in this edge.\n"
01299 "   :type vert: :class:`BMVert`\n"
01300 "   :return: The edges other vert.\n"
01301 "   :rtype: :class:`BMVert` or None\n"
01302 );
01303 static PyObject *bpy_bmedge_other_vert(BPy_BMEdge *self, BPy_BMVert *value)
01304 {
01305     BMVert *other;
01306     BPY_BM_CHECK_OBJ(self);
01307 
01308     if (!BPy_BMVert_Check(value)) {
01309         PyErr_Format(PyExc_TypeError,
01310                      "BMEdge.other_vert(vert): BMVert expected, not '%.200s'",
01311                      Py_TYPE(value)->tp_name);
01312         return NULL;
01313     }
01314 
01315     BPY_BM_CHECK_OBJ(value);
01316 
01317     if (self->bm != value->bm) {
01318         PyErr_SetString(PyExc_ValueError,
01319                         "BMEdge.other_vert(vert): vert is from another mesh");
01320         return NULL;
01321     }
01322 
01323     other = BM_edge_other_vert(self->e, value->v);
01324 
01325     if (other) {
01326         return BPy_BMVert_CreatePyObject(self->bm, other);
01327     }
01328     else {
01329         /* could raise an exception here */
01330         Py_RETURN_NONE;
01331     }
01332 }

01389 
01390 PyDoc_STRVAR(bpy_bmface_copy_doc,
01391 ".. method:: copy(verts=True, edges=True)\n"
01392 "\n"
01393 "   Make a copy of this face.\n"
01394 "\n"
01395 "   :arg verts: When set, the faces verts will be duplicated too.\n"
01396 "   :type verts: boolean\n"
01397 "   :arg edges: When set, the faces edges will be duplicated too.\n"
01398 "   :type edges: boolean\n"
01399 "   :return: The newly created face.\n"
01400 "   :rtype: :class:`BMFace`\n"
01401 );
01402 static PyObject *bpy_bmface_copy(BPy_BMFace *self, PyObject *args, PyObject *kw)
01403 {
01404     static const char *kwlist[] = {"verts", "edges", NULL};
01405 
01406     BMesh *bm = self->bm;
01407     int do_verts = TRUE;
01408     int do_edges = TRUE;
01409 
01410     BMFace *f_cpy;
01411     BPY_BM_CHECK_OBJ(self);
01412 
01413     if (!PyArg_ParseTupleAndKeywords(args, kw,
01414                                      "|ii:BMFace.copy",
01415                                      (char **)kwlist,
01416                                      &do_verts, &do_edges))
01417     {
01418         return NULL;
01419     }
01420 
01421     f_cpy = BM_face_copy(bm, self->f, do_verts, do_edges);
01422 
01423     if (f_cpy) {
01424         return BPy_BMFace_CreatePyObject(bm, f_cpy);
01425     }
01426     else {
01427         PyErr_SetString(PyExc_ValueError,
01428                         "BMFace.copy(): couldn't create the new face, internal error");
01429         return NULL;
01430     }
01431 }

01520 "\n"
01521 "   Interpolate the customdata from a face onto this loop (the loops vert should overlap the face).\n"
01522 "\n"
01523 "   :arg face: The face to interpolate data from.\n"
01524 "   :type face: :class:`BMFace`\n"
01525 "   :arg vert: When enabled, interpolate the loops vertex data (optional).\n"
01526 "   :type vert: boolean\n"
01527 "   :arg multires: When enabled, interpolate the loops multires data (optional).\n"
01528 "   :type multires: boolean\n"
01529 );
01530 static PyObject *bpy_bmloop_copy_from_face_interp(BPy_BMLoop *self, PyObject *args)
01531 {
01532     BPy_BMFace *py_face = NULL;
01533     int do_vertex   = TRUE;
01534     int do_multires = TRUE;
01535 
01536     BPY_BM_CHECK_OBJ(self);
01537 
01538     if (!PyArg_ParseTuple(args, "O!|ii:BMLoop.copy_from_face_interp",
01539                           &BPy_BMFace_Type, &py_face,
01540                           &do_vertex, &do_multires))
01541     {
01542         return NULL;
01543     }
01544     else {
01545         BMesh *bm = self->bm;
01546 
01547         BPY_BM_CHECK_OBJ(py_face);
01548 
01549         if (py_face->bm != bm) {
01550             PyErr_SetString(PyExc_ValueError,
01551                             "BMLoop.copy_from_face_interp(face): face is from another mesh");
01552             return NULL;
01553         }
01554 
01555         BM_loop_interp_from_face(bm, self->l, py_face->f, do_vertex, do_multires);
01556 
01557         Py_RETURN_NONE;
01558     }

01610 
01611 /* Vert Seq
01612  * -------- */
01613 PyDoc_STRVAR(bpy_bmvertseq_new_doc,
01614 ".. method:: new(co=(0.0, 0.0, 0.0), example=None)\n"
01615 "\n"
01616 "   Create a new vertex.\n"
01617 "\n"
01618 "   :arg co: The initial location of the vertex (optional argument).\n"
01619 "   :type co: float triplet\n"
01620 "   :arg example: Existing vert to initialize settings.\n"
01621 "   :type example: :class:`BMVert`\n"
01622 "   :return: The newly created edge.\n"
01623 "   :rtype: :class:`BMVert`\n"
01624 );
01625 static PyObject *bpy_bmvertseq_new(BPy_BMElemSeq *self, PyObject *args)
01626 {
01627     PyObject *py_co = NULL;
01628     BPy_BMVert *py_vert_example = NULL; /* optional */
01629 
01630     BPY_BM_CHECK_OBJ(self);
01631 
01632     if (!PyArg_ParseTuple(args, "|OO!:verts.new",
01633                           &py_co,
01634                           &BPy_BMVert_Type, &py_vert_example))
01635     {
01636         return NULL;
01637     }
01638     else {
01639         BMesh *bm = self->bm;
01640         BMVert *v;
01641         float co[3] = {0.0f, 0.0f, 0.0f};
01642 
01643         if (py_vert_example) {
01644             BPY_BM_CHECK_OBJ(py_vert_example);
01645         }
01646 
01647         if (py_co && mathutils_array_parse(co, 3, 3, py_co, "verts.new(co)") == -1) {
01648             return NULL;
01649         }
01650 
01651         v = BM_vert_create(bm, co, NULL);
01652 
01653         if (v == NULL) {
01654             PyErr_SetString(PyExc_ValueError,
01655                             "faces.new(verts): couldn't create the new face, internal error");
01656             return NULL;
01657         }
01658 
01659         if (py_vert_example) {
01660             BM_elem_attrs_copy(py_vert_example->bm, bm, py_vert_example->v, v);
01661         }
01662 
01663         return BPy_BMVert_CreatePyObject(bm, v);
01664     }
01665 }
01666 
01667 
01668 /* Edge Seq
01669  * -------- */
01670 PyDoc_STRVAR(bpy_bmedgeseq_new_doc,
01671 ".. method:: new(verts, example=None)\n"
01672 "\n"
01673 "   Create a new edge from a given pair of verts.\n"
01674 "\n"
01675 "   :arg verts: Vertex pair.\n"
01676 "   :type verts: pair of :class:`BMVert`\n"
01677 "   :arg example: Existing edge to initialize settings (optional argument).\n"
01678 "   :type example: :class:`BMEdge`\n"
01679 "   :return: The newly created edge.\n"
01680 "   :rtype: :class:`BMEdge`\n"
01681 );
01682 static PyObject *bpy_bmedgeseq_new(BPy_BMElemSeq *self, PyObject *args)
01683 {
01684     PyObject *vert_seq;
01685     BPy_BMEdge *py_edge_example = NULL; /* optional */
01686 
01687     BPY_BM_CHECK_OBJ(self);
01688 
01689     if (!PyArg_ParseTuple(args, "O|O!:edges.new",
01690                           &vert_seq,
01691                           &BPy_BMEdge_Type, &py_edge_example))
01692     {
01693         return NULL;
01694     }
01695     else {
01696         BMesh *bm = self->bm;
01697         BMEdge *e;
01698         BMVert **vert_array = NULL;
01699         Py_ssize_t vert_seq_len; /* always 2 */
01700         PyObject *ret = NULL;
01701 
01702         if (py_edge_example) {
01703             BPY_BM_CHECK_OBJ(py_edge_example);
01704         }
01705 
01706         vert_array = BPy_BMElem_PySeq_As_Array(&bm, vert_seq, 2, 2,
01707                                                &vert_seq_len, BM_VERT,
01708                                                TRUE, TRUE, "edges.new(...)");
01709 
01710         if (vert_array == NULL) {
01711             return NULL;
01712         }
01713         
01714         if (BM_edge_exists(vert_array[0], vert_array[1])) {
01715             PyErr_SetString(PyExc_ValueError,
01716                             "edges.new(): this edge exists");
01717             goto cleanup;
01718         }
01719 
01720         e = BM_edge_create(bm, vert_array[0], vert_array[1], NULL, FALSE);
01721 
01722         if (e == NULL) {
01723             PyErr_SetString(PyExc_ValueError,
01724                             "faces.new(verts): couldn't create the new face, internal error");
01725             goto cleanup;
01726         }
01727 
01728         if (py_edge_example) {
01729             BM_elem_attrs_copy(py_edge_example->bm, bm, py_edge_example->e, e);
01730         }
01731 
01732         ret = BPy_BMEdge_CreatePyObject(bm, e);
01733 
01734 cleanup:
01735         if (vert_array) PyMem_FREE(vert_array);
01736         return ret;
01737     }
01738 }
01739 
01740 
01741 /* Face Seq
01742  * -------- */
01743 PyDoc_STRVAR(bpy_bmfaceseq_new_doc,
01744 ".. method:: new(verts, example=None)\n"
01745 "\n"
01746 "   Create a new face from a given set of verts.\n"
01747 "\n"
01748 "   :arg verts: Sequence of 3 or more verts.\n"
01749 "   :type verts: :class:`BMVert`\n"
01750 "   :arg example: Existing face to initialize settings (optional argument).\n"
01751 "   :type example: :class:`BMFace`\n"
01752 "   :return: The newly created face.\n"
01753 "   :rtype: :class:`BMFace`\n"
01754 );
01755 static PyObject *bpy_bmfaceseq_new(BPy_BMElemSeq *self, PyObject *args)
01756 {
01757     PyObject *vert_seq;
01758     BPy_BMFace *py_face_example = NULL; /* optional */
01759 
01760     BPY_BM_CHECK_OBJ(self);
01761 
01762     if (!PyArg_ParseTuple(args, "O|O!:faces.new",
01763                           &vert_seq,
01764                           &BPy_BMFace_Type, &py_face_example))
01765     {
01766         return NULL;
01767     }
01768     else {
01769         BMesh *bm = self->bm;
01770         Py_ssize_t vert_seq_len;
01771         Py_ssize_t i, i_next;
01772 
01773         BMVert **vert_array = NULL;
01774         BMEdge **edge_array = NULL;
01775 
01776         PyObject *ret = NULL;
01777 
01778         BMFace *f_new;
01779 
01780         if (py_face_example) {
01781             BPY_BM_CHECK_OBJ(py_face_example);
01782         }
01783 
01784         vert_array = BPy_BMElem_PySeq_As_Array(&bm, vert_seq, 3, PY_SSIZE_T_MAX,
01785                                                &vert_seq_len, BM_VERT,
01786                                                TRUE, TRUE, "faces.new(...)");
01787 
01788         if (vert_array == NULL) {
01789             return NULL;
01790         }
01791 
01792         /* check if the face exists */
01793         if (BM_face_exists(bm, vert_array, vert_seq_len, NULL)) {
01794             PyErr_SetString(PyExc_ValueError,
01795                             "faces.new(verts): face already exists");
01796             goto cleanup;
01797         }
01798 
01799         /* Go ahead and make the face!
01800          * --------------------------- */
01801 
01802         edge_array = (BMEdge **)PyMem_MALLOC(vert_seq_len * sizeof(BMEdge **));
01803 
01804         /* ensure edges */
01805         for (i = vert_seq_len - 1, i_next = 0; i_next < vert_seq_len; (i = i_next++)) {
01806             edge_array[i] = BM_edge_create(bm, vert_array[i], vert_array[i_next], NULL, TRUE);
01807         }
01808 
01809         f_new = BM_face_create(bm, vert_array, edge_array, vert_seq_len, FALSE);
01810 
01811         if (f_new == NULL) {
01812             PyErr_SetString(PyExc_ValueError,
01813                             "faces.new(verts): couldn't create the new face, internal error");
01814             goto cleanup;
01815         }
01816 
01817         if (py_face_example) {
01818             BM_elem_attrs_copy(py_face_example->bm, bm, py_face_example->f, f_new);
01819         }
01820 
01821         ret = BPy_BMFace_CreatePyObject(bm, f_new);
01822 
01823         /* pass through */
01824 cleanup:
01825         if (vert_array) PyMem_FREE(vert_array);
01826         if (edge_array) PyMem_FREE(edge_array);
01827         return ret;
01828     }
01829 }
01830 
01831 /* Elem Seq
01832  * -------- */
01833 
01834 PyDoc_STRVAR(bpy_bmvertseq_remove_doc,
01835 ".. method:: remove(vert)\n"
01836 "\n"
01837 "   Remove a vert.\n"
01838 );
01839 static PyObject *bpy_bmvertseq_remove(BPy_BMElemSeq *self, BPy_BMVert *value)
01840 {
01841     BPY_BM_CHECK_OBJ(self);
01842 
01843     if (!BPy_BMVert_Check(value)) {
01844         return NULL;
01845     }
01846     else {
01847         BMesh *bm = self->bm;
01848 
01849         BPY_BM_CHECK_OBJ(value);
01850 
01851         if (value->bm != bm) {
01852             PyErr_SetString(PyExc_ValueError,
01853                             "verts.remove(vert): vert is from another mesh");
01854             return NULL;
01855         }
01856 
01857         BM_vert_kill(bm, value->v);
01858         bpy_bm_generic_invalidate((BPy_BMGeneric *)value);
01859 
01860         Py_RETURN_NONE;
01861     }
01862 }
01863 
01864 PyDoc_STRVAR(bpy_bmedgeseq_remove_doc,
01865 ".. method:: remove(edge)\n"
01866 "\n"
01867 "   Remove a edge.\n"
01868 );
01869 static PyObject *bpy_bmedgeseq_remove(BPy_BMElemSeq *self, BPy_BMEdge *value)
01870 {
01871     BPY_BM_CHECK_OBJ(self);
01872 
01873     if (!BPy_BMEdge_Check(value)) {
01874         return NULL;
01875     }
01876     else {
01877         BMesh *bm = self->bm;
01878 
01879         BPY_BM_CHECK_OBJ(value);
01880 
01881         if (value->bm != bm) {
01882             PyErr_SetString(PyExc_ValueError,
01883                             "edges.remove(edge): edge is from another mesh");
01884             return NULL;
01885         }
01886 
01887         BM_edge_kill(bm, value->e);
01888         bpy_bm_generic_invalidate((BPy_BMGeneric *)value);
01889 
01890         Py_RETURN_NONE;
01891     }
01892 }

01924 PyDoc_STRVAR(bpy_bmedgeseq_get__method_doc,
01925 ".. method:: get(verts, fallback=None)\n"
01926 "\n"
01927 "   Return a edge which uses the **verts** passed.\n"
01928 "\n"
01929 "   :arg verts: Sequence of verts.\n"
01930 "   :type verts: :class:`BMVert`\n"
01931 "   :arg fallback: Return this value if nothing is found.\n"
01932 "   :return: The edge found or None\n"
01933 "   :rtype: :class:`BMEdge`\n"
01934 );
01935 static PyObject *bpy_bmedgeseq_get__method(BPy_BMElemSeq *self, PyObject *args)
01936 {
01937     PyObject *vert_seq;
01938     PyObject *fallback = Py_None; /* optional */
01939 
01940     BPY_BM_CHECK_OBJ(self);
01941 
01942     if (!PyArg_ParseTuple(args, "O|O:edges.get",
01943                           &vert_seq,
01944                           &fallback))
01945     {
01946         return NULL;
01947     }
01948     else {
01949         BMesh *bm = self->bm;
01950         BMEdge *e;
01951         BMVert **vert_array = NULL;
01952         Py_ssize_t vert_seq_len; /* always 2 */
01953         PyObject *ret = NULL;
01954 
01955         vert_array = BPy_BMElem_PySeq_As_Array(&bm, vert_seq, 2, 2,
01956                                                &vert_seq_len, BM_VERT,
01957                                                TRUE, TRUE, "edges.get(...)");
01958 
01959         if (vert_array == NULL) {
01960             return NULL;
01961         }
01962 
01963         if ((e = BM_edge_exists(vert_array[0], vert_array[1]))) {
01964             ret = BPy_BMEdge_CreatePyObject(bm, e);
01965         }
01966         else {
01967             ret = fallback;
01968             Py_INCREF(ret);
01969         }
01970 
01971         PyMem_FREE(vert_array);
01972         return ret;
01973     }
01974 }
01975 
01976 PyDoc_STRVAR(bpy_bmfaceseq_get__method_doc,
01977 ".. method:: get(verts, fallback=None)\n"
01978 "\n"
01979 "   Return a face which uses the **verts** passed.\n"
01980 "\n"
01981 "   :arg verts: Sequence of verts.\n"
01982 "   :type verts: :class:`BMVert`\n"
01983 "   :arg fallback: Return this value if nothing is found.\n"
01984 "   :return: The face found or None\n"
01985 "   :rtype: :class:`BMFace`\n"
01986 );
01987 static PyObject *bpy_bmfaceseq_get__method(BPy_BMElemSeq *self, PyObject *args)
01988 {
01989     PyObject *vert_seq;
01990     PyObject *fallback = Py_None; /* optional */
01991 
01992     BPY_BM_CHECK_OBJ(self);
01993 
01994     if (!PyArg_ParseTuple(args, "O|O:faces.get",
01995                           &vert_seq,
01996                           &fallback))
01997     {
01998         return NULL;
01999     }
02000     else {
02001         BMesh *bm = self->bm;
02002         BMFace *f = NULL;
02003         BMVert **vert_array = NULL;
02004         Py_ssize_t vert_seq_len;
02005         PyObject *ret = NULL;
02006 
02007         vert_array = BPy_BMElem_PySeq_As_Array(&bm, vert_seq, 1, PY_SSIZE_T_MAX,
02008                                                &vert_seq_len, BM_VERT,
02009                                                TRUE, TRUE, "faces.get(...)");
02010 
02011         if (vert_array == NULL) {
02012             return NULL;
02013         }
02014 
02015         if (BM_face_exists(bm, vert_array, vert_seq_len, &f)) {
02016             ret = BPy_BMFace_CreatePyObject(bm, f);
02017         }
02018         else {
02019             ret = fallback;
02020             Py_INCREF(ret);
02021         }
02022 
02023         PyMem_FREE(vert_array);
02024         return ret;
02025     }
02026 }
02027 
02028 PyDoc_STRVAR(bpy_bmelemseq_index_update_doc,
02029 ".. method:: index_update()\n"
02030 "\n"
02031 "   Initialize the index values of this sequence.\n"
02032 "\n"
02033 "   This is the equivalent of looping over all elements and assigning the index values.\n"
02034 "\n"
02035 "   .. code-block:: python\n"
02036 "\n"
02037 "      for index, ele in enumerate(sequence):\n"
02038 "          ele.index = index\n"
02039 "\n"
02040 "   .. note::\n"
02041 "\n"
02042 "      Running this on sequences besides :class:`BMesh.verts`, :class:`BMesh.edges`, :class:`BMesh.faces`\n"
02043 "      works but wont result in each element having a valid index, insted its order in the sequence will be set.\n"
02044 );
02045 static PyObject *bpy_bmelemseq_index_update(BPy_BMElemSeq *self)
02046 {
02047     BMesh *bm = self->bm;
02048 
02049     BPY_BM_CHECK_OBJ(self);
02050 
02051     switch ((BMIterType)self->itype) {
02052         case BM_VERTS_OF_MESH:
02053             BM_mesh_elem_index_ensure(self->bm, BM_VERT);
02054             break;
02055         case BM_EDGES_OF_MESH:
02056             BM_mesh_elem_index_ensure(self->bm, BM_EDGE);
02057             break;
02058         case BM_FACES_OF_MESH:
02059             BM_mesh_elem_index_ensure(self->bm, BM_FACE);
02060             break;
02061         default:
02062         {
02063             BMIter iter;
02064             BMElem *ele;
02065             int index = 0;
02066             const char htype = bm_iter_itype_htype_map[self->itype];
02067 
02068             BM_ITER_BPY_BM_SEQ(ele, &iter, self) {
02069                 BM_elem_index_set(ele, index); /* set_dirty! */
02070                 index++;
02071             }
02072 
02073             if (htype & (BM_VERT | BM_EDGE | BM_FACE)) {
02074                 /* since this isn't the normal vert/edge/face loops,
02075                  * we're setting dirty values here. so tag as dirty. */
02076                 bm->elem_index_dirty |= htype;
02077             }
02078 
02079             break;
02080         }
02081     }
02082 
02083     Py_RETURN_NONE;
02084 }
02085

02203 static struct PyMethodDef bpy_bmloopseq_methods[] = {
02204     /* odd function, initializes index values */
02205     /* no: index_update() function since we cant iterate over loops */
02206     {NULL, NULL, 0, NULL}
02207 };
02208 
02209 /* Sequences
02210  * ========= */
02211 
02212 /* BMElemSeq / Iter
02213  * ---------------- */
02214 
02215 static PyTypeObject *bpy_bm_itype_as_pytype(const char itype)
02216 {
02217     /* should cover all types */
02218     switch ((BMIterType)itype) {
02219         case BM_VERTS_OF_MESH:
02220         case BM_VERTS_OF_FACE:
02221         case BM_VERTS_OF_EDGE:
02222             return &BPy_BMVert_Type;
02223 
02224         case BM_EDGES_OF_MESH:
02225         case BM_EDGES_OF_FACE:
02226         case BM_EDGES_OF_VERT:
02227             return &BPy_BMEdge_Type;
02228 
02229         case BM_FACES_OF_MESH:
02230         case BM_FACES_OF_EDGE:
02231         case BM_FACES_OF_VERT:
02232             return &BPy_BMFace_Type;
02233 
02234         case BM_ALL_LOOPS_OF_FACE:
02235         case BM_LOOPS_OF_FACE:
02236         case BM_LOOPS_OF_EDGE:
02237         case BM_LOOPS_OF_VERT:
02238         case BM_LOOPS_OF_LOOP:
02239             return &BPy_BMLoop_Type;
02240     }
02241 
02242     return NULL;
02243 }
02244 
02245 static Py_ssize_t bpy_bmelemseq_length(BPy_BMElemSeq *self)
02246 {
02247     BPY_BM_CHECK_INT(self);
02248 
02249     /* first check if the size is known */
02250     switch ((BMIterType)self->itype) {
02251         /* main-types */
02252         case BM_VERTS_OF_MESH:
02253             return self->bm->totvert;
02254         case BM_EDGES_OF_MESH:
02255             return self->bm->totedge;
02256         case BM_FACES_OF_MESH:
02257             return self->bm->totface;
02258 
02259             /* sub-types */
02260         case BM_VERTS_OF_FACE:
02261         case BM_EDGES_OF_FACE:
02262         case BM_LOOPS_OF_FACE:
02263             BPY_BM_CHECK_INT(self->py_ele);
02264             return ((BMFace *)self->py_ele->ele)->len;
02265 
02266         case BM_VERTS_OF_EDGE:
02267             return 2;
02268 
02269         default:
02270             /* quiet compiler */
02271             break;
02272     }
02273 
02274 
02275     /* loop over all items, avoid this if we can */
02276     {
02277         BMIter iter;
02278         BMHeader *ele;
02279         Py_ssize_t tot = 0;
02280 
02281         BM_ITER_BPY_BM_SEQ(ele, &iter, self) {
02282             tot++;
02283         }
02284         return tot;
02285     }
02286 }
02287 
02288 static PyObject *bpy_bmelemseq_subscript_int(BPy_BMElemSeq *self, int keynum)
02289 {
02290     BPY_BM_CHECK_OBJ(self);
02291 
02292     if (keynum < 0) keynum += bpy_bmelemseq_length(self); /* only get length on negative value, may loop entire seq */
02293     if (keynum >= 0) {
02294         BMHeader *ele = BM_iter_at_index(self->bm, self->itype, self->py_ele ? self->py_ele->ele : NULL, keynum);
02295         if (ele) {
02296             return BPy_BMElem_CreatePyObject(self->bm, ele);
02297         }
02298     }
02299 
02300     PyErr_Format(PyExc_IndexError,
02301                  "BMElemSeq[index]: index %d out of range", keynum);
02302     return NULL;
02303 }
02304 
02305 static PyObject *bpy_bmelemseq_subscript_slice(BPy_BMElemSeq *self, Py_ssize_t start, Py_ssize_t stop)
02306 {
02307     BMIter iter;
02308     int count = 0;
02309     int ok;
02310 
02311     PyObject *list;
02312     PyObject *item;
02313     BMHeader *ele;
02314 
02315     BPY_BM_CHECK_OBJ(self);
02316 
02317     list = PyList_New(0);
02318 
02319     ok = BM_iter_init(&iter, self->bm, self->itype, self->py_ele ? self->py_ele->ele : NULL);
02320 
02321     BLI_assert(ok == TRUE);
02322 
02323     if (UNLIKELY(ok == FALSE)) {
02324         return list;
02325     }
02326 
02327     /* first loop up-until the start */
02328     for (ok = TRUE; ok; ok = (BM_iter_step(&iter) != NULL)) {
02329         if (count == start) {
02330             break;
02331         }
02332         count++;
02333     }
02334 
02335     /* add items until stop */
02336     while ((ele = BM_iter_step(&iter))) {
02337         item = BPy_BMElem_CreatePyObject(self->bm, ele);
02338         PyList_Append(list, item);
02339         Py_DECREF(item);
02340 
02341         count++;
02342         if (count == stop) {
02343             break;
02344         }
02345     }
02346 
02347     return list;
02348 }
02349 
02350 static PyObject *bpy_bmelemseq_subscript(BPy_BMElemSeq *self, PyObject *key)
02351 {
02352     /* don't need error check here */
02353     if (PyIndex_Check(key)) {
02354         Py_ssize_t i = PyNumber_AsSsize_t(key, PyExc_IndexError);
02355         if (i == -1 && PyErr_Occurred())
02356             return NULL;
02357         return bpy_bmelemseq_subscript_int(self, i);
02358     }
02359     else if (PySlice_Check(key)) {
02360         PySliceObject *key_slice = (PySliceObject *)key;
02361         Py_ssize_t step = 1;
02362 
02363         if (key_slice->step != Py_None && !_PyEval_SliceIndex(key, &step)) {
02364             return NULL;
02365         }
02366         else if (step != 1) {
02367             PyErr_SetString(PyExc_TypeError,
02368                             "BMElemSeq[slice]: slice steps not supported");
02369             return NULL;
02370         }
02371         else if (key_slice->start == Py_None && key_slice->stop == Py_None) {
02372             return bpy_bmelemseq_subscript_slice(self, 0, PY_SSIZE_T_MAX);
02373         }
02374         else {
02375             Py_ssize_t start = 0, stop = PY_SSIZE_T_MAX;
02376 
02377             /* avoid PySlice_GetIndicesEx because it needs to know the length ahead of time. */
02378             if (key_slice->start != Py_None && !_PyEval_SliceIndex(key_slice->start, &start)) return NULL;
02379             if (key_slice->stop != Py_None && !_PyEval_SliceIndex(key_slice->stop, &stop))    return NULL;
02380 
02381             if (start < 0 || stop < 0) {
02382                 /* only get the length for negative values */
02383                 Py_ssize_t len = bpy_bmelemseq_length(self);
02384                 if (start < 0) start += len;
02385                 if (stop < 0) start += len;
02386             }
02387 
02388             if (stop - start <= 0) {
02389                 return PyList_New(0);
02390             }
02391             else {
02392                 return bpy_bmelemseq_subscript_slice(self, start, stop);
02393             }
02394         }
02395     }
02396     else {
02397         PyErr_SetString(PyExc_AttributeError,
02398                         "BMElemSeq[key]: invalid key, key must be an int");
02399         return NULL;
02400     }
02401 }
02402 
02403 static int bpy_bmelemseq_contains(BPy_BMElemSeq *self, PyObject *value)
02404 {
02405     BPY_BM_CHECK_INT(self);
02406 
02407     if (Py_TYPE(value) == bpy_bm_itype_as_pytype(self->itype)) {
02408         BPy_BMElem *value_bm_ele = (BPy_BMElem *)value;
02409         if (value_bm_ele->bm == self->bm) {
02410             BMElem *ele, *ele_test = value_bm_ele->ele;
02411             BMIter iter;
02412             BM_ITER_BPY_BM_SEQ(ele, &iter, self) {
02413                 if (ele == ele_test) {
02414                     return 1;
02415                 }
02416             }
02417         }
02418     }
02419 
02420     return 0;
02421 }
02422 
02423 /* BMElem (customdata)
02424  * ------------------- */
02425 
02426 static PyObject *bpy_bmelem_subscript(BPy_BMElem *self, BPy_BMLayerItem *key)
02427 {
02428     BPY_BM_CHECK_OBJ(self);
02429 
02430     return BPy_BMLayerItem_GetItem(self, key);
02431 }
02432 
02433 static int bpy_bmelem_ass_subscript(BPy_BMElem *self, BPy_BMLayerItem *key, PyObject *value)
02434 {
02435     BPY_BM_CHECK_INT(self);
02436 
02437     return BPy_BMLayerItem_SetItem(self, key, value);
02438 }
02439 
02440 static PySequenceMethods bpy_bmelemseq_as_sequence = {
02441     (lenfunc)bpy_bmelemseq_length,                  /* sq_length */
02442     NULL,                                        /* sq_concat */
02443     NULL,                                        /* sq_repeat */
02444     (ssizeargfunc)bpy_bmelemseq_subscript_int,      /* sq_item */ /* Only set this so PySequence_Check() returns True */
02445     NULL,                                        /* sq_slice */
02446     (ssizeobjargproc)NULL,                       /* sq_ass_item */
02447     NULL,                                        /* *was* sq_ass_slice */
02448     (objobjproc)bpy_bmelemseq_contains,             /* sq_contains */
02449     (binaryfunc) NULL,                           /* sq_inplace_concat */
02450     (ssizeargfunc) NULL,                         /* sq_inplace_repeat */
02451 };
02452 
02453 static PyMappingMethods bpy_bmelemseq_as_mapping = {
02454     (lenfunc)bpy_bmelemseq_length,                  /* mp_length */
02455     (binaryfunc)bpy_bmelemseq_subscript,            /* mp_subscript */
02456     (objobjargproc)NULL,                         /* mp_ass_subscript */
02457 };
02458 
02459 /* for customdata access */
02460 static PyMappingMethods bpy_bm_elem_as_mapping = {
02461     (lenfunc)NULL,                           /* mp_length */ /* keep this empty, messes up 'if elem: ...' test */
02462     (binaryfunc)bpy_bmelem_subscript,        /* mp_subscript */
02463     (objobjargproc)bpy_bmelem_ass_subscript, /* mp_ass_subscript */
02464 };
02465 
02466 /* Iterator
02467  * -------- */
02468 
02469 static PyObject *bpy_bmelemseq_iter(BPy_BMElemSeq *self)
02470 {
02471     BPy_BMIter *py_iter;
02472 
02473     BPY_BM_CHECK_OBJ(self);
02474     py_iter = (BPy_BMIter *)BPy_BMIter_CreatePyObject(self->bm);
02475     BM_iter_init(&(py_iter->iter), self->bm, self->itype, self->py_ele ? self->py_ele->ele : NULL);
02476     return (PyObject *)py_iter;
02477 }
02478 
02479 static PyObject *bpy_bmiter_next(BPy_BMIter *self)
02480 {
02481     BMHeader *ele = BM_iter_step(&self->iter);
02482     if (ele == NULL) {
02483         PyErr_SetString(PyExc_StopIteration,
02484                         "bpy_bmiter_next stop");
02485         return NULL;
02486     }
02487     else {
02488         return (PyObject *)BPy_BMElem_CreatePyObject(self->bm, ele);
02489     }
02490 }
02491 
02492 
02493 /* Dealloc Functions
02494  * ================= */
02495 
02496 static void bpy_bmesh_dealloc(BPy_BMesh *self)
02497 {
02498     BMesh *bm = self->bm;
02499 
02500     /* have have been freed by bmesh */
02501     if (bm) {
02502         BM_data_layer_free(bm, &bm->vdata, CD_BM_ELEM_PYPTR);
02503         BM_data_layer_free(bm, &bm->edata, CD_BM_ELEM_PYPTR);
02504         BM_data_layer_free(bm, &bm->pdata, CD_BM_ELEM_PYPTR);
02505         BM_data_layer_free(bm, &bm->ldata, CD_BM_ELEM_PYPTR);
02506 
02507         bm->py_handle = NULL;
02508 
02509         if ((self->flag & BPY_BMFLAG_IS_WRAPPED) == 0) {
02510             BM_mesh_free(bm);
02511         }
02512     }
02513 
02514     PyObject_DEL(self);
02515 }
02516 
02517 static void bpy_bmvert_dealloc(BPy_BMElem *self)
02518 {
02519     BMesh *bm = self->bm;
02520     if (bm) {
02521         void **ptr = CustomData_bmesh_get(&bm->vdata, self->ele->head.data, CD_BM_ELEM_PYPTR);
02522         *ptr = NULL;
02523     }
02524     PyObject_DEL(self);
02525 }
02526 
02527 static void bpy_bmedge_dealloc(BPy_BMElem *self)
02528 {
02529     BMesh *bm = self->bm;
02530     if (bm) {
02531         void **ptr = CustomData_bmesh_get(&bm->edata, self->ele->head.data, CD_BM_ELEM_PYPTR);
02532         *ptr = NULL;
02533     }
02534     PyObject_DEL(self);
02535 }
02536 
02537 static void bpy_bmface_dealloc(BPy_BMElem *self)
02538 {
02539     BMesh *bm = self->bm;
02540     if (bm) {
02541         void **ptr = CustomData_bmesh_get(&bm->pdata, self->ele->head.data, CD_BM_ELEM_PYPTR);
02542         *ptr = NULL;
02543     }
02544     PyObject_DEL(self);
02545 }
02546 
02547 static void bpy_bmloop_dealloc(BPy_BMElem *self)
02548 {
02549     BMesh *bm = self->bm;
02550     if (bm) {
02551         void **ptr = CustomData_bmesh_get(&bm->ldata, self->ele->head.data, CD_BM_ELEM_PYPTR);
02552         *ptr = NULL;
02553     }
02554     PyObject_DEL(self);
02555 }
02556 
02557 static void bpy_bmelemseq_dealloc(BPy_BMElemSeq *self)
02558 {
02559     Py_XDECREF(self->py_ele);
02560 
02561     PyObject_DEL(self);
02562 }

02566 {
02567     return _Py_HashPointer(((BPy_BMElem *)self)->ele);
02568 }

02575 /* Type Docstrings
02576  * =============== */
02577 
02578 PyDoc_STRVAR(bpy_bmesh_doc,
02579 "The BMesh data structure\n"
02580 );
02581 PyDoc_STRVAR(bpy_bmvert_doc,
02582 "The BMesh vertex type\n"
02583 );
02584 PyDoc_STRVAR(bpy_bmedge_doc,
02585 "The BMesh edge connecting 2 verts\n"
02586 );
02587 PyDoc_STRVAR(bpy_bmface_doc,
02588 "The BMesh face with 3 or more sides\n"
02589 );
02590 PyDoc_STRVAR(bpy_bmloop_doc,
02591 "This is normally accessed from :class:`BMFace.loops` where each face corner represents a corner of a face.\n"
02592 );
02593 PyDoc_STRVAR(bpy_bmelemseq_doc,
02594 "General sequence type used for accessing any sequence of \n"
02595 ":class:`BMVert`, :class:`BMEdge`, :class:`BMFace`, :class:`BMLoop`.\n"
02596 "\n"
02597 "When accessed via :class:`BMesh.verts`, :class:`BMesh.edges`, :class:`BMesh.faces` \n"
02598 "there are also functions to create/remomove items.\n"
02599 );
02600 PyDoc_STRVAR(bpy_bmiter_doc,
02601 "Internal BMesh type for looping over verts/faces/edges,\n"
02602 "used for iterating over :class:`BMElemSeq` types.\n"
02603 );
02604 
02605 static PyObject *bpy_bmesh_repr(BPy_BMesh *self)
02606 {
02607     BMesh *bm = self->bm;
02608 
02609     if (bm) {
02610         return PyUnicode_FromFormat("<BMesh(%p), totvert=%d, totedge=%d, totface=%d, totloop=%d>",
02611                                     bm, bm->totvert, bm->totedge, bm->totface, bm->totloop);
02612     }
02613     else {
02614         return PyUnicode_FromFormat("<BMesh dead at %p>", self);
02615     }
02616 }
02617 
02618 static PyObject *bpy_bmvert_repr(BPy_BMVert *self)
02619 {
02620     BMesh *bm = self->bm;
02621 
02622     if (bm) {
02623         BMVert *v = self->v;
02624         return PyUnicode_FromFormat("<BMVert(%p), index=%d>",
02625                                     v, BM_elem_index_get(v));
02626     }
02627     else {
02628         return PyUnicode_FromFormat("<BMVert dead at %p>", self);
02629     }
02630 }
02631 
02632 static PyObject *bpy_bmedge_repr(BPy_BMEdge *self)
02633 {
02634     BMesh *bm = self->bm;
02635 
02636     if (bm) {
02637         BMEdge *e = self->e;
02638         return PyUnicode_FromFormat("<BMEdge(%p), index=%d, verts=(%p/%d, %p/%d)>",
02639                                     e, BM_elem_index_get(e),
02640                                     e->v1, BM_elem_index_get(e->v1),
02641                                     e->v2, BM_elem_index_get(e->v2));
02642     }
02643     else {
02644         return PyUnicode_FromFormat("<BMEdge dead at %p>", self);
02645     }
02646 }
02647 
02648 static PyObject *bpy_bmface_repr(BPy_BMFace *self)
02649 {
02650     BMesh *bm = self->bm;
02651 
02652     if (bm) {
02653         BMFace *f = self->f;
02654         return PyUnicode_FromFormat("<BMFace(%p), index=%d, totverts=%d>",
02655                                     f, BM_elem_index_get(f),
02656                                     f->len);
02657     }
02658     else {
02659         return PyUnicode_FromFormat("<BMFace dead at %p>", self);
02660     }
02661 }
02662 
02663 static PyObject *bpy_bmloop_repr(BPy_BMLoop *self)
02664 {
02665     BMesh *bm = self->bm;
02666 
02667     if (bm) {
02668         BMLoop *l = self->l;
02669         return PyUnicode_FromFormat("<BMLoop(%p), index=%d, vert=%p/%d, edge=%p/%d, face=%p/%d>",
02670                                     l, BM_elem_index_get(l),
02671                                     l->v, BM_elem_index_get(l->v),
02672                                     l->e, BM_elem_index_get(l->e),
02673                                     l->f, BM_elem_index_get(l->f));
02674     }
02675     else {
02676         return PyUnicode_FromFormat("<BMLoop dead at %p>", self);
02677     }
02678 }

02697 void BPy_BM_init_types(void)
02698 {
02699     BPy_BMesh_Type.tp_basicsize     = sizeof(BPy_BMesh);
02700     BPy_BMVert_Type.tp_basicsize    = sizeof(BPy_BMVert);
02701     BPy_BMEdge_Type.tp_basicsize    = sizeof(BPy_BMEdge);
02702     BPy_BMFace_Type.tp_basicsize    = sizeof(BPy_BMFace);
02703     BPy_BMLoop_Type.tp_basicsize    = sizeof(BPy_BMLoop);
02704     BPy_BMElemSeq_Type.tp_basicsize = sizeof(BPy_BMElemSeq);
02705     BPy_BMVertSeq_Type.tp_basicsize = sizeof(BPy_BMElemSeq);
02706     BPy_BMEdgeSeq_Type.tp_basicsize = sizeof(BPy_BMElemSeq);
02707     BPy_BMFaceSeq_Type.tp_basicsize = sizeof(BPy_BMElemSeq);
02708     BPy_BMLoopSeq_Type.tp_basicsize = sizeof(BPy_BMElemSeq);
02709     BPy_BMIter_Type.tp_basicsize    = sizeof(BPy_BMIter);
02710 
02711 
02712     BPy_BMesh_Type.tp_name     = "BMesh";
02713     BPy_BMVert_Type.tp_name    = "BMVert";
02714     BPy_BMEdge_Type.tp_name    = "BMEdge";
02715     BPy_BMFace_Type.tp_name    = "BMFace";
02716     BPy_BMLoop_Type.tp_name    = "BMLoop";
02717     BPy_BMElemSeq_Type.tp_name = "BMElemSeq";
02718     BPy_BMVertSeq_Type.tp_name = "BMVertSeq";
02719     BPy_BMEdgeSeq_Type.tp_name = "BMEdgeSeq";
02720     BPy_BMFaceSeq_Type.tp_name = "BMFaceSeq";
02721     BPy_BMLoopSeq_Type.tp_name = "BMLoopSeq";
02722     BPy_BMIter_Type.tp_name    = "BMIter";
02723 
02724 
02725     BPy_BMesh_Type.tp_doc     = bpy_bmesh_doc;
02726     BPy_BMVert_Type.tp_doc    = bpy_bmvert_doc;
02727     BPy_BMEdge_Type.tp_doc    = bpy_bmedge_doc;
02728     BPy_BMFace_Type.tp_doc    = bpy_bmface_doc;
02729     BPy_BMLoop_Type.tp_doc    = bpy_bmloop_doc;
02730     BPy_BMElemSeq_Type.tp_doc = bpy_bmelemseq_doc;
02731     BPy_BMVertSeq_Type.tp_doc = NULL;
02732     BPy_BMEdgeSeq_Type.tp_doc = NULL;
02733     BPy_BMFaceSeq_Type.tp_doc = NULL;
02734     BPy_BMLoopSeq_Type.tp_doc = NULL;
02735     BPy_BMIter_Type.tp_doc    = bpy_bmiter_doc;
02736 
02737 
02738     BPy_BMesh_Type.tp_repr     = (reprfunc)bpy_bmesh_repr;
02739     BPy_BMVert_Type.tp_repr    = (reprfunc)bpy_bmvert_repr;
02740     BPy_BMEdge_Type.tp_repr    = (reprfunc)bpy_bmedge_repr;
02741     BPy_BMFace_Type.tp_repr    = (reprfunc)bpy_bmface_repr;
02742     BPy_BMLoop_Type.tp_repr    = (reprfunc)bpy_bmloop_repr;
02743     BPy_BMElemSeq_Type.tp_repr = NULL;
02744     BPy_BMVertSeq_Type.tp_repr = NULL;
02745     BPy_BMEdgeSeq_Type.tp_repr = NULL;
02746     BPy_BMFaceSeq_Type.tp_repr = NULL;
02747     BPy_BMLoopSeq_Type.tp_repr = NULL;
02748     BPy_BMIter_Type.tp_repr    = NULL;
02749 
02750 
02751     BPy_BMesh_Type.tp_getset     = bpy_bmesh_getseters;
02752     BPy_BMVert_Type.tp_getset    = bpy_bmvert_getseters;
02753     BPy_BMEdge_Type.tp_getset    = bpy_bmedge_getseters;
02754     BPy_BMFace_Type.tp_getset    = bpy_bmface_getseters;
02755     BPy_BMLoop_Type.tp_getset    = bpy_bmloop_getseters;
02756     BPy_BMElemSeq_Type.tp_getset = NULL;
02757     BPy_BMVertSeq_Type.tp_getset = bpy_bmvertseq_getseters;
02758     BPy_BMEdgeSeq_Type.tp_getset = bpy_bmedgeseq_getseters;
02759     BPy_BMFaceSeq_Type.tp_getset = bpy_bmfaceseq_getseters;
02760     BPy_BMLoopSeq_Type.tp_getset = bpy_bmloopseq_getseters;
02761     BPy_BMIter_Type.tp_getset    = NULL;
02762 
02763 
02764     BPy_BMesh_Type.tp_methods     = bpy_bmesh_methods;
02765     BPy_BMVert_Type.tp_methods    = bpy_bmvert_methods;
02766     BPy_BMEdge_Type.tp_methods    = bpy_bmedge_methods;
02767     BPy_BMFace_Type.tp_methods    = bpy_bmface_methods;
02768     BPy_BMLoop_Type.tp_methods    = bpy_bmloop_methods;

02771     BPy_BMEdgeSeq_Type.tp_methods = bpy_bmedgeseq_methods;
02772     BPy_BMFaceSeq_Type.tp_methods = bpy_bmfaceseq_methods;
02773     BPy_BMLoopSeq_Type.tp_methods = bpy_bmloopseq_methods;
02774     BPy_BMIter_Type.tp_methods    = NULL;
02775

02778     BPy_BMVert_Type.tp_hash    = bpy_bm_elem_hash;
02779     BPy_BMEdge_Type.tp_hash    = bpy_bm_elem_hash;

02781     BPy_BMLoop_Type.tp_hash    = bpy_bm_elem_hash;
02782     BPy_BMElemSeq_Type.tp_hash = NULL;
02783     BPy_BMVertSeq_Type.tp_hash = NULL;
02784     BPy_BMEdgeSeq_Type.tp_hash = NULL;
02785     BPy_BMFaceSeq_Type.tp_hash = NULL;
02786     BPy_BMLoopSeq_Type.tp_hash = NULL;
02787     BPy_BMIter_Type.tp_hash    = NULL;
02788

02790     BPy_BMVertSeq_Type.tp_as_sequence = &bpy_bmelemseq_as_sequence;
02791     BPy_BMEdgeSeq_Type.tp_as_sequence = &bpy_bmelemseq_as_sequence;
02792     BPy_BMFaceSeq_Type.tp_as_sequence = &bpy_bmelemseq_as_sequence;
02793     BPy_BMLoopSeq_Type.tp_as_sequence = NULL; /* this is not a seq really, only for layer access */
02794 
02795     BPy_BMElemSeq_Type.tp_as_mapping = &bpy_bmelemseq_as_mapping;
02796     BPy_BMVertSeq_Type.tp_as_mapping = &bpy_bmelemseq_as_mapping;
02797     BPy_BMEdgeSeq_Type.tp_as_mapping = &bpy_bmelemseq_as_mapping;
02798     BPy_BMFaceSeq_Type.tp_as_mapping = &bpy_bmelemseq_as_mapping;
02799     BPy_BMLoopSeq_Type.tp_as_mapping = NULL; /* this is not a seq really, only for layer access */
02800 
02801     /* layer access */
02802     BPy_BMVert_Type.tp_as_mapping    = &bpy_bm_elem_as_mapping;
02803     BPy_BMEdge_Type.tp_as_mapping    = &bpy_bm_elem_as_mapping;
02804     BPy_BMFace_Type.tp_as_mapping    = &bpy_bm_elem_as_mapping;
02805     BPy_BMLoop_Type.tp_as_mapping    = &bpy_bm_elem_as_mapping;
02806

02808     BPy_BMVertSeq_Type.tp_iter = (getiterfunc)bpy_bmelemseq_iter;
02809     BPy_BMEdgeSeq_Type.tp_iter = (getiterfunc)bpy_bmelemseq_iter;
02810     BPy_BMFaceSeq_Type.tp_iter = (getiterfunc)bpy_bmelemseq_iter;
02811     BPy_BMLoopSeq_Type.tp_iter = NULL; /* no mapping */
02812 
02813     /* only 1 iteratir so far */
02814     BPy_BMIter_Type.tp_iternext = (iternextfunc)bpy_bmiter_next;
02815     BPy_BMIter_Type.tp_iter     = PyObject_SelfIter;
02816 
02817     BPy_BMesh_Type.tp_dealloc     = (destructor)bpy_bmesh_dealloc;
02818     BPy_BMVert_Type.tp_dealloc    = (destructor)bpy_bmvert_dealloc;
02819     BPy_BMEdge_Type.tp_dealloc    = (destructor)bpy_bmedge_dealloc;
02820     BPy_BMFace_Type.tp_dealloc    = (destructor)bpy_bmface_dealloc;
02821     BPy_BMLoop_Type.tp_dealloc    = (destructor)bpy_bmloop_dealloc;
02822     BPy_BMElemSeq_Type.tp_dealloc = (destructor)bpy_bmelemseq_dealloc;
02823     BPy_BMVertSeq_Type.tp_dealloc = (destructor)bpy_bmelemseq_dealloc;
02824     BPy_BMEdgeSeq_Type.tp_dealloc = (destructor)bpy_bmelemseq_dealloc;
02825     BPy_BMFaceSeq_Type.tp_dealloc = (destructor)bpy_bmelemseq_dealloc;
02826     BPy_BMLoopSeq_Type.tp_dealloc = (destructor)bpy_bmelemseq_dealloc;
02827     BPy_BMIter_Type.tp_dealloc    = NULL;
02828 
02829     BPy_BMesh_Type.tp_flags     = Py_TPFLAGS_DEFAULT;
02830     BPy_BMVert_Type.tp_flags    = Py_TPFLAGS_DEFAULT;
02831     BPy_BMEdge_Type.tp_flags    = Py_TPFLAGS_DEFAULT;
02832     BPy_BMFace_Type.tp_flags    = Py_TPFLAGS_DEFAULT;
02833     BPy_BMLoop_Type.tp_flags    = Py_TPFLAGS_DEFAULT;
02834     BPy_BMElemSeq_Type.tp_flags = Py_TPFLAGS_DEFAULT;
02835     BPy_BMVertSeq_Type.tp_flags = Py_TPFLAGS_DEFAULT;
02836     BPy_BMEdgeSeq_Type.tp_flags = Py_TPFLAGS_DEFAULT;
02837     BPy_BMFaceSeq_Type.tp_flags = Py_TPFLAGS_DEFAULT;
02838     BPy_BMLoopSeq_Type.tp_flags = Py_TPFLAGS_DEFAULT;
02839     BPy_BMIter_Type.tp_flags    = Py_TPFLAGS_DEFAULT;
02840 
02841 
02842     PyType_Ready(&BPy_BMesh_Type);
02843     PyType_Ready(&BPy_BMVert_Type);
02844     PyType_Ready(&BPy_BMEdge_Type);
02845     PyType_Ready(&BPy_BMFace_Type);
02846     PyType_Ready(&BPy_BMLoop_Type);
02847     PyType_Ready(&BPy_BMElemSeq_Type);
02848     PyType_Ready(&BPy_BMVertSeq_Type);
02849     PyType_Ready(&BPy_BMEdgeSeq_Type);
02850     PyType_Ready(&BPy_BMFaceSeq_Type);
02851     PyType_Ready(&BPy_BMLoopSeq_Type);
02852     PyType_Ready(&BPy_BMIter_Type);
02853 }

02855 /* bmesh.types submodule
02856  * ********************* */
02857 
02858 static struct PyModuleDef BPy_BM_types_module_def = {
02859     PyModuleDef_HEAD_INIT,
02860     "bmesh.types",  /* m_name */
02861     NULL,  /* m_doc */
02862     0,  /* m_size */
02863     NULL,  /* m_methods */
02864     NULL,  /* m_reload */
02865     NULL,  /* m_traverse */
02866     NULL,  /* m_clear */
02867     NULL,  /* m_free */
02868 };
02869 
02870 PyObject *BPyInit_bmesh_types(void)
02871 {
02872     PyObject *submodule;
02873 
02874     submodule = PyModule_Create(&BPy_BM_types_module_def);
02875 
02876 #define MODULE_TYPE_ADD(s, t) \
02877     PyModule_AddObject(s, t.tp_name, (PyObject *)&t); Py_INCREF((PyObject *)&t)
02878 
02879     /* bmesh_py_types.c */
02880     MODULE_TYPE_ADD(submodule, BPy_BMesh_Type);
02881     MODULE_TYPE_ADD(submodule, BPy_BMVert_Type);
02882     MODULE_TYPE_ADD(submodule, BPy_BMEdge_Type);
02883     MODULE_TYPE_ADD(submodule, BPy_BMFace_Type);
02884     MODULE_TYPE_ADD(submodule, BPy_BMLoop_Type);
02885     MODULE_TYPE_ADD(submodule, BPy_BMElemSeq_Type);
02886     MODULE_TYPE_ADD(submodule, BPy_BMVertSeq_Type);
02887     MODULE_TYPE_ADD(submodule, BPy_BMEdgeSeq_Type);
02888     MODULE_TYPE_ADD(submodule, BPy_BMFaceSeq_Type);
02889     MODULE_TYPE_ADD(submodule, BPy_BMLoopSeq_Type);
02890     MODULE_TYPE_ADD(submodule, BPy_BMIter_Type);
02891     /* bmesh_py_types_select.c */
02892     MODULE_TYPE_ADD(submodule, BPy_BMEditSelSeq_Type);
02893     MODULE_TYPE_ADD(submodule, BPy_BMEditSelIter_Type);
02894     /* bmesh_py_types_customdata.c */
02895     MODULE_TYPE_ADD(submodule, BPy_BMLayerAccessVert_Type);
02896     MODULE_TYPE_ADD(submodule, BPy_BMLayerAccessEdge_Type);
02897     MODULE_TYPE_ADD(submodule, BPy_BMLayerAccessFace_Type);
02898     MODULE_TYPE_ADD(submodule, BPy_BMLayerAccessLoop_Type);
02899     MODULE_TYPE_ADD(submodule, BPy_BMLayerCollection_Type);
02900     MODULE_TYPE_ADD(submodule, BPy_BMLayerItem_Type);
02901     /* bmesh_py_types_meshdata.c */
02902     MODULE_TYPE_ADD(submodule, BPy_BMLoopUV_Type);
02903     MODULE_TYPE_ADD(submodule, BPy_BMDeformVert_Type);
02904 
02905 #undef MODULE_TYPE_ADD
02906 
02907     return submodule;
02908 }

02910 /* Utility Functions
02911  * ***************** */
02912 
02913 PyObject *BPy_BMesh_CreatePyObject(BMesh *bm, int flag)
02914 {
02915     BPy_BMesh *self;
02916 
02917     if (bm->py_handle) {
02918         self = bm->py_handle;
02919         Py_INCREF(self);
02920     }
02921     else {
02922         self = PyObject_New(BPy_BMesh, &BPy_BMesh_Type);
02923         self->bm = bm;
02924         self->flag = flag;
02925 
02926         bm->py_handle = self; /* point back */
02927 
02928         BM_data_layer_add(bm, &bm->vdata, CD_BM_ELEM_PYPTR);
02929         BM_data_layer_add(bm, &bm->edata, CD_BM_ELEM_PYPTR);
02930         BM_data_layer_add(bm, &bm->pdata, CD_BM_ELEM_PYPTR);
02931         BM_data_layer_add(bm, &bm->ldata, CD_BM_ELEM_PYPTR);
02932     }
02933 
02934     return (PyObject *)self;
02935 }
02936 
02937 
02938 
02939 PyObject *BPy_BMVert_CreatePyObject(BMesh *bm, BMVert *v)
02940 {
02941     BPy_BMVert *self;
02942 
02943     void **ptr = CustomData_bmesh_get(&bm->vdata, v->head.data, CD_BM_ELEM_PYPTR);
02944 
02945     /* bmesh may free layers, ensure we have one to store ourself */
02946     if (UNLIKELY(ptr == NULL)) {
02947         BM_data_layer_add(bm, &bm->vdata, CD_BM_ELEM_PYPTR);
02948         ptr = CustomData_bmesh_get(&bm->vdata, v->head.data, CD_BM_ELEM_PYPTR);
02949     }
02950 
02951     if (*ptr != NULL) {
02952         self = *ptr;
02953         Py_INCREF(self);
02954     }
02955     else {
02956         self = PyObject_New(BPy_BMVert, &BPy_BMVert_Type);
02957         BLI_assert(v != NULL);
02958         self->bm = bm;
02959         self->v  = v;
02960         *ptr = self;
02961     }
02962     return (PyObject *)self;
02963 }
02964 
02965 PyObject *BPy_BMEdge_CreatePyObject(BMesh *bm, BMEdge *e)
02966 {
02967     BPy_BMEdge *self;
02968 
02969     void **ptr = CustomData_bmesh_get(&bm->edata, e->head.data, CD_BM_ELEM_PYPTR);
02970 
02971     /* bmesh may free layers, ensure we have one to store ourself */
02972     if (UNLIKELY(ptr == NULL)) {
02973         BM_data_layer_add(bm, &bm->edata, CD_BM_ELEM_PYPTR);
02974         ptr = CustomData_bmesh_get(&bm->edata, e->head.data, CD_BM_ELEM_PYPTR);
02975     }
02976 
02977     if (*ptr != NULL) {
02978         self = *ptr;
02979         Py_INCREF(self);
02980     }
02981     else {
02982         self = PyObject_New(BPy_BMEdge, &BPy_BMEdge_Type);
02983         BLI_assert(e != NULL);
02984         self->bm = bm;
02985         self->e  = e;
02986         *ptr = self;
02987     }
02988     return (PyObject *)self;
02989 }

03096 
03097 /* this is just a helper func */
03098 PyObject *BPy_BMElem_CreatePyObject(BMesh *bm, BMHeader *ele)
03099 {
03100     switch (ele->htype) {
03101         case BM_VERT:
03102             return BPy_BMVert_CreatePyObject(bm, (BMVert *)ele);
03103         case BM_EDGE:
03104             return BPy_BMEdge_CreatePyObject(bm, (BMEdge *)ele);
03105         case BM_FACE:
03106             return BPy_BMFace_CreatePyObject(bm, (BMFace *)ele);
03107         case BM_LOOP:
03108             return BPy_BMLoop_CreatePyObject(bm, (BMLoop *)ele);
03109         default:
03110             PyErr_SetString(PyExc_SystemError, "internal error");
03111             return NULL;
03112     }
03113 }
03114 
03115 int bpy_bm_generic_valid_check(BPy_BMGeneric *self)
03116 {
03117     if (LIKELY(self->bm)) {
03118         return 0;
03119     }
03120     else {
03121         PyErr_Format(PyExc_ReferenceError,
03122                      "BMesh data of type %.200s has been removed",
03123                      Py_TYPE(self)->tp_name);
03124         return -1;
03125     }
03126 }
03127 
03128 void bpy_bm_generic_invalidate(BPy_BMGeneric *self)
03129 {
03130     self->bm = NULL;
03131 }
03132 
03133 /* generic python seq as BMVert/Edge/Face array,
03134  * return value must be freed with PyMem_FREE(...);
03135  *
03136  * The 'bm_r' value is assigned when empty, and used when set.
03137  */
03138 void *BPy_BMElem_PySeq_As_Array(BMesh **r_bm, PyObject *seq, Py_ssize_t min, Py_ssize_t max, Py_ssize_t *r_size,
03139                                 const char htype,
03140                                 const char do_unique_check, const char do_bm_check,
03141                                 const char *error_prefix)
03142 {
03143     BMesh *bm = (r_bm && *r_bm) ? *r_bm : NULL;
03144     PyObject *seq_fast;
03145     *r_size = 0;
03146 
03147     if (!(seq_fast = PySequence_Fast(seq, error_prefix))) {
03148         return NULL;
03149     }
03150     else {
03151         Py_ssize_t seq_len;
03152         Py_ssize_t i;
03153 
03154         BPy_BMElem *item;
03155         BMElem **alloc;
03156 
03157         seq_len = PySequence_Fast_GET_SIZE(seq_fast);
03158 
03159         if (seq_len < min || seq_len > max) {
03160             PyErr_Format(PyExc_TypeError,
03161                          "%s: sequence incorrect size, expected [%d - %d], given %d",
03162                          error_prefix, min, max, seq_len);
03163             return NULL;
03164         }
03165 
03166 
03167         /* from now on, use goto */
03168         alloc = PyMem_MALLOC(seq_len * sizeof(BPy_BMElem **));
03169 
03170         for (i = 0; i < seq_len; i++) {
03171             item = (BPy_BMElem *)PySequence_Fast_GET_ITEM(seq_fast, i);
03172 
03173             if (!BPy_BMElem_CheckHType(Py_TYPE(item), htype)) {
03174                 PyErr_Format(PyExc_TypeError,
03175                              "%s: expected %.200s, not '%.200s'",
03176                              error_prefix, BPy_BMElem_StringFromHType(htype), Py_TYPE(item)->tp_name);
03177                 goto err_cleanup;
03178             }
03179             else if (!BPY_BM_IS_VALID(item)) {
03180                 PyErr_Format(PyExc_TypeError,
03181                              "%s: %d %s has been removed",
03182                              error_prefix, i, Py_TYPE(item)->tp_name);
03183                 goto err_cleanup;
03184             }
03185             /* trick so we can ensure all items have the same mesh,
03186              * and allows us to pass the 'bm' as NULL. */
03187             else if (do_bm_check && (bm  && bm != item->bm)) {
03188                 PyErr_Format(PyExc_ValueError,
03189                              "%s: %d %s is from another mesh",
03190                              error_prefix, i, BPy_BMElem_StringFromHType(htype));
03191                 goto err_cleanup;
03192             }
03193 
03194             if (bm == NULL) {
03195                 bm = item->bm;
03196             }
03197 
03198             alloc[i] = item->ele;
03199 
03200             if (do_unique_check) {
03201                 BM_elem_flag_enable(item->ele, BM_ELEM_INTERNAL_TAG);
03202             }
03203         }
03204 
03205         if (do_unique_check) {
03206             /* check for double verts! */
03207             int ok = TRUE;
03208             for (i = 0; i < seq_len; i++) {
03209                 if (UNLIKELY(BM_elem_flag_test(alloc[i], BM_ELEM_INTERNAL_TAG) == FALSE)) {
03210                     ok = FALSE;
03211                 }
03212 
03213                 /* ensure we don't leave this enabled */
03214                 BM_elem_flag_disable(alloc[i], BM_ELEM_INTERNAL_TAG);
03215             }
03216 
03217             if (ok == FALSE) {
03218                 PyErr_Format(PyExc_ValueError,
03219                              "%s: found the same %.200s used multiple times",
03220                              error_prefix, BPy_BMElem_StringFromHType(htype));
03221                 goto err_cleanup;
03222             }
03223         }
03224 
03225         Py_DECREF(seq_fast);
03226         *r_size = seq_len;
03227         if (r_bm) *r_bm = bm;
03228         return alloc;
03229 
03230 err_cleanup:
03231         Py_DECREF(seq_fast);
03232         PyMem_FREE(alloc);
03233         return NULL;
03234     }
03235 }
03236 
03237 
03238 PyObject *BPy_BMElem_Array_As_Tuple(BMesh *bm, BMHeader **elem, Py_ssize_t elem_len)
03239 {
03240     Py_ssize_t i;
03241     PyObject *ret = PyTuple_New(elem_len);
03242     for (i = 0; i < elem_len; i++) {
03243         PyTuple_SET_ITEM(ret, i, BPy_BMElem_CreatePyObject(bm, elem[i]));
03244     }
03245 
03246     return ret;
03247 }
03248 
03249 int BPy_BMElem_CheckHType(PyTypeObject *type, const char htype)
03250 {
03251     return (((htype & BM_VERT) && (type == &BPy_BMVert_Type)) ||
03252             ((htype & BM_EDGE) && (type == &BPy_BMEdge_Type)) ||
03253             ((htype & BM_FACE) && (type == &BPy_BMFace_Type)) ||
03254             ((htype & BM_LOOP) && (type == &BPy_BMLoop_Type)));
03255 }
03256 
03262 char *BPy_BMElem_StringFromHType_ex(const char htype, char ret[32])
03263 {
03264     /* zero to ensure string is always NULL terminated */
03265     char *ret_ptr = ret;
03266     if (htype & BM_VERT) ret_ptr += sprintf(ret_ptr, "/%s", BPy_BMVert_Type.tp_name);
03267     if (htype & BM_EDGE) ret_ptr += sprintf(ret_ptr, "/%s", BPy_BMEdge_Type.tp_name);
03268     if (htype & BM_FACE) ret_ptr += sprintf(ret_ptr, "/%s", BPy_BMFace_Type.tp_name);
03269     if (htype & BM_LOOP) ret_ptr += sprintf(ret_ptr, "/%s", BPy_BMLoop_Type.tp_name);
03270     ret[0]   = '(';
03271     *ret_ptr = ')';
03272     return ret;
03273 }
03274 char *BPy_BMElem_StringFromHType(const char htype)
03275 {
03276     /* zero to ensure string is always NULL terminated */
03277     static char ret[32];
03278     return BPy_BMElem_StringFromHType_ex(htype, ret);
03279 }
